author: Edmund Dobry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
review_content: Alright this review is about as honest as you can get. In general the product is nice looking, well built, materials seem to be decent including the labeled 3M tape (I question authenticity) . The LED brightness is on par with other LED products in this price range. Overall it is an average LED RGB lighting product. I cannot tell you about the Bluetooth function or app, as I never did make it that far. My experience with this product stopped at the installation! Why did I stop there? I have the double side series 4 light kit. The biggest issue is how these lights are wired, even with two lights per wire, they are wired in series making installation extremely difficult if you like the wired to be hidden and no bundles of wire stuff or crammed into one spot. I originally wanted to do locations under the dashboard and under the front seats of my F150.  That being said, if you want to feed the wires through and under dashboard or console parts you cannot do that, as the wires do not disconnect which means you would have to fish the entire LED system through LED lights, controller and power point. So hiding your wires is impossible! Next, having the lights in series on one side each means you are running double wire on your furthest LED light. The controller is nice, it is a mate black plastic housing with three buttons power, color and music mode. The power plug is big, but does have a switch on the back of the plug for turning off and on. The included hardware ie., screws are useless for vehicle installation, you would be lucky to ever get them into any type of plastic to secure your lights. The 3M tape is generic looking tape with white background, there is no trademark on the tape I suspect it is fake 3M tape even the 3M logo is halfway cut off which is not how 3M tape comes, with the included screws and the tape, my opinion is that the screws are useless inside a car, the tape will not last long in the summer or hot areas of the south and mid-west. As with any inferior tape product for inside the car the heat will loosen these light pods and in time they will fall off. With all that said, I cannot recommend this product for vehicle use. There may be a more useful application for this product with some modification such as on a boat, in a house, or the bed of a truck. If you do not mind wires all over the place and a sub par installation, you could get this product to work. I think overall you will be dissatisfied with the installation, the fake 3M tape will not last long and you will find yourself heading to the auto parts store for real 3M tape. Overall - do not buy, you get less then what you are paying for, this is import junk cheap product and you will only end up replacing it, or never installing it like me.
title: If you expect to do a professional installation, and do not mind fake materials!

author: Matty B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020
review_content: I feel stupid for buying a $65 TypeS kit from Auto Zone. I fell for the fancy holographic packaging. The kit was flimsy. The light strips crumbled after 9 months. The adhesive came loose and the plugs absolutely sucked and constantly came disconnected from the strips. Out of constant frustration over tinkering with them I just ripped them out and threw them away.I really missed having lights in my car and was extremely apprehensive of this brand I've never heard of and the price it was offered for. After reading the reviews and remembering Amazon's return policy I figured what the heck and ordered it.These things are in a class of their own. They are bright, the adhesive is SUPER strong (and it comes with tiny screws if you'd rather do that) and the app connects quickly and is quick and easy to use. The strips themselves are stronger and more durable than the TypeS ones I originally had and the LEDs are enclosed entirely. The best part: all of the strips are permanently connected. No more frustrations with loose connections! The wires were more than long enough to reach my backseat as well! I would recommend using velcro in the back if your seats aren't plastic underneath. I hard-wired these directly into my fuse box using one of the "add a fuse" kits sold on Amazon to hide the cables and mounted the control switch directly under the dash by my steering wheel. The switch is easy to reach, but hidden as well. I use the app for all preference setting, but can still reach down and turn them off quickly if I need to. The ONLY thing I miss about the TypeS versus these is the ability to independently control the colors per strip (have blue under driver side, pink under passenger, etc). Other than that, it is super cool having such a wide variety of color schemes, the "create your own" scenes, brightness adjustment and their reactions to music playing is on point and responsive. Installation took less than 30 minutes and thats only because i didn't properly secure the ground wire and it took me 10 minutes to figure that out. You will not regret purchasing these.

author: Wez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020
review_content: GUYS. okay. Legit. These lights are so great! I just got a new car (legit just a box) for college, so I wanted to spice it up with something (also, quarantine, i'm bored out of my mind). Ended up getting these lights, cutting the cigarette lighter off, hardwiring it to the fusebox, and it turned out perfectly.I had no idea you could adjust the brightness with the app. But still, I was more than happy with the turnout. The lights were bright, but not SUPER bright like some reviews had. I came back to write a review and I saw that some people were complaining that they were too bright, and that's when I realized YOU CAN USE THE APP TO ADJUST IT. My mind is blown. I turned the brightness all the way up this morning, and you definitely can appreciate the lights during the daytime.The app is super easy to install. Create an account, pick the device, and that's it. You can pick ANY color from the colorwheel they give you, you can set your own modes, choose custom colors and custom speeds, you can have it cycle or blink or whatever. For example, I have mine set to 3 colors that I picked out on a slow gradual cycle.My car only had one cigarette lighter, and I needed that for the phone, which is why I had to hardwire mine. I would expect that if you have any newer car, you probably could spare a cigarette lighter for these babies. The cords are pretty easy to slip under the trim parts of your car,ALSO, did I mention that they provide zip ties AND screws for you already.ALSO, regarding the 3M tape, I didn't get a chance to try the 3M tape on the lights (I found the zipties easier), but I did use the 3M tape on the back of the control panel thing, and it stuck super well (although it's only been one day). In fact, I had to reposition it, so I stuck it twice and it's still on there. I was expecting to use gorilla glue anyway, so if the adhesion of the tape is your holdup, it's REALLY not a big deal.MUSIC MODE. you can change the sensitivity on the app. I didn't try it, because the sensitivity was fine when I brought it out of the box. It works super well. No complaints.Really probably one of the best investments I've made.
title: Would've given it 10 stars, and I didn't even realize it had an app

author: L-Knight
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
review_content: I just installed these a week ago, so I can't give 5 stars until I can judge their longevity, but right now, they are working great. I put them in my truck, which has no real back seat to speak of, so they are doubled up in the front of my cab. I have one strip on each side pointing at the floor and one strip running up the bottom sides of the dashboard, illuminating the rest of the floor, the sides of the doors, and some of the seat edge.They are nice and bright for what they are. The colors are pleasant, and while you can switch colors manually with the little control box, I installed the app to connect to them and change it to a rainbow effect that alternates with music. Once set, though, it seems to keep the setting even when the truck is turned off, so it's not like you need to keep the app on your phone if you're not going to use it. I'm not sure if changing out the battery of the truck will set it back to default or not, though. I'll find out when I change the battery later on.So far, the adhesion is working fine. I even had to remove one strip to move it, and I figured that was going to be it for that strip, but I tried it and it's still hanging on to its new position. They include tiny nails and zip ties if you'd rather go that way, but the strips are working fine right now.The wires seem plenty long enough to allow you to route them nicely. I can't speak for how well they reach the back seat, as like I said, mine are both up front. They look long enough, and I did toy with putting them back there somewhere, but there's just no room.The lights do "dance" with the music as well as can be expected, and I can see them during the day, but mostly only use them at night. They are bright enough that if you were standing outside the truck, you could see a faint glow on the headrests. I know because I did exactly that because I wondered how much of the cab was being illuminated. Aim both towards the floor and you may not have that happen.  Don't know.If they last, I'll try to update the review. If not, I'll try doing the same.
